intro: Scutinanthe brevisepala, commonly known as the short-winged scutinanthe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
